title: Youngest Indian Girl Who Climbed Everest, Now Scales Mount Kilimanjaro In Just 3 Days
text:
The youngest Indian girl to have scaled Everest is 17-year-old Shivangi Pathak. After that incredible feat, Shivangi has set a new record. The Haryana girl has scaled Africa's highest peak, Mount Kilimanjaro in three days. While the official confirmation of her new record is awaited, the happiness on her face is hard to contain.

Shivangi, who has also participated in different high-altitude training in the glaciers in Kashmir, said she always wanted to stand out from the crowd.

facebook / everester shivangi pathak

"I always wanted to do something different and stand out from the crowd. I saw a video of Arunima Sinha and started researching about mountaineering. This inspired me to take up this activity," she told the news agency. Brought up in Hisar, Shivangi could not stop thanking her family for their endless support.

"Girls need to convince their parents that they can achieve their goals. Parents, in turn, should support their daughters in every way possible. There is nothing that women can't do," she added.

In an earlier interview, she had said, "My only mission is to conquer every mountain on this beautiful planet." Shivangi is now eyeing to scale Europe's highest peak. Earlier when she scaled Mt Everest, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had called her achievement "stupendous. The teenager completed her courses in basic and advance mountaineering from Jawahar Institute of Mountain.

With inputs from ANI
